alert.note: Alert for Harding (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:55PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Harding, Butte and north central Lawrence Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 655 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Gustave to 6 miles west of Newell Lake to Vale. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newell and Vale around 700 PM MDT. Castle Rock and Newell Lake around 715 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Owl Butte, Redig and Crow Buttes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northwestern and west central South Dakota.
